Front: What mnemonic helps remember the order of sharps added (F-C-G-D-A-E-B)?
Back: "Father Charles Goes Down And Ends Battle"

Front: "Father Charles Goes Down And Ends Battle" helps you remember what?
Back: The order of sharps added: F-C-G-D-A-E-B

Front: What mnemonic helps remember the order of flats added (B-E-A-D-G-C-F)?
Back: "Battle Ends And Down Goes Charles' Father" (reverse of the sharps mnemonic)

Front: "Battle Ends And Down Goes Charles' Father" helps you remember what?
Back: The order of flats added: B-E-A-D-G-C-F

Front: What mnemonic helps remember the major sharp keys (G-D-A-E-B-F♯-C♯)?
Back: "Good Dogs Always Eat Before Fighting Cats"

Front: "Good Dogs Always Eat Before Fighting Cats" helps you remember what?
Back: The major sharp keys in order: G (1♯), D (2♯), A (3♯), E (4♯), B (5♯), F♯ (6♯), C♯ (7♯)

Front: What mnemonic helps remember the major flat keys (F-B♭-E♭-A♭-D♭-G♭-C♭)?
Back: "Father Brown Eats Apple Dumplings Greedily, Child"

Front: "Father Brown Eats Apple Dumplings Greedily, Child" helps you remember what?
Back: The major flat keys in order: F (1♭), B♭ (2♭), E♭ (3♭), A♭ (4♭), D♭ (5♭), G♭ (6♭), C♭ (7♭)

Front: What mnemonic helps remember the 3 enharmonic sharp minors (G♯-D♯-A♯)?
Back: "Get Down Already" (because they're down in the circle!)

Front: "Get Down Already" helps you remember what?
Back: The 3 enharmonic sharp minor keys: G♯ minor (5♯), D♯ minor (6♯), A♯ minor (7♯)

Front: What mnemonic helps remember treble clef lines (E-G-B-D-F)?
"Every Good Boy Does Fine" helps you remember what?
Back: Treble clef lines from bottom to top: E-G-B-D-F

Front: What mnemonic helps remember treble clef spaces (F-A-C-E)?

Back: Treble clef spaces from bottom to top: F-A-C-E

Front: What mnemonic helps remember bass clef lines (G-B-D-F-A)?
"Good Boys Do Fine Always" helps you remember what?
Back: Bass clef lines from bottom to top: G-B-D-F-A

Front: What mnemonic helps remember bass clef spaces (A-C-E-G)?
"All Cows Eat Grass" helps you remember what?
Back: Bass clef spaces from bottom to top: A-C-E-G

Front: How are the sharps and flats order mnemonics related?
Back: They're palindromes! "Father Charles Goes Down And Ends Battle" reversed gives "Battle Ends And Down Goes Charles' Father"
